context: The Estonian verb 'töötada' means to work or to be employed. It's an infinitive form of a regular -da ending verb. In the first sentence, it's used in present tense with 'ma' (I), showing regular conjugation. The second sentence shows past tense ('töötasin') indicating I worked all day. The third example uses negative form with 'ei tööta' meaning he/she doesn't work currently.
